H0.text: Annual rainfall would increase if Earth revolved at a faster rate.

H1.text: Daylight hours would decrease if Earth revolved at a faster rate.

H2.text: Seasons would be shorter is the most likely outcome if Earth revolved at a faster rate.

H3.text: Annual temperature variation would be greater if Earth revolved at a faster rate.

A4.text: Scientists reported that in 2020 Earth had started spinning faster, after consistently spinning slower than 86,400 seconds per day in the decades before.
